page.title: 02Ambrosden Village
page.content: Ambrosden is divided by a busy road & is quite small with about 1300 civilian inhabitants but has a large army estate of redbrick houses for the soldiers & a smaller estate for the officers who have slightly better houses. Garrison population is about 3200. There are 2 farms in the village & a pig-farm & bus stop by Five Acres Primary School.There is a garage, pub, Post Office, hair- dresser, 2 general stores & a Village Hall in the old school. Over the road is a phone box, St Mary's CE Church & graveyard. Near the NAAFI is an Army Education Centre, MOD Police Station, gym, library, Medical Centre, Community House, Youth Club, Families Club & Advice Bureau, St Barbara's RC Church, outside swimming pool & a workshop. There is an army light railway at the bottom of the village. There are many garages & free army emergency phones.
